title: ISic030281. ISicily 030281
body:
Facsimile Images

[---] ος ἀναλῳ[μα ---]
[--- κατ]α̣λογὰν τᾶς πόλ[ιος ---]
[---]ς ὥστε αὐτοὺς ἐν [---]
[---]εσθαι τάν τε παροχ[ὰν ---]
5[---] ἀπέλυσε ⸢τᾶς⸣ πα̣ροχ[ᾶς ---]
[--- τῶι δὲ μουνι]κιπίωι τῶν Ἀκραγαντί[νων πάτριόν ἐστι καὶ ἐκ προγόνων]
[παραδεδο]μένον τιμεῖν τοὺς ἀ[γαθοὺς ἄνδρας ---]
[--- ἐ]π̣ὶ ἀγαθᾷ τύχᾳ καὶ σω[τηρίᾳ τοῦ δάμου · δεδόχθαι τῶι μου-]
[νικιπίωι] τ̣ῶν Ἀκραγαντίν[ων ---]
10[εἴμειν πρόξε]ν̣ον καὶ εὐερ̣[γέταν ---]

Apparatus criticus

Text after Robert, with minor modifications. As Robert notes, the exact placing of the line breaks is necessarily hypothetical.; Robert prints [-- κατα]λογὰν, but reports a visible oblique stroke before the lamda, compatible with either alpha or lamda.
5: Robert, Manganaro: τ(ᾶ)ς; Kaibel: ΤΕΣ (= τᾶς?); the photo of the bronze shows a large and crude epsilon.Robert: π(α)ροχ[ᾶς]; Kaibel: ΠΚΡΟΧ (= π[α]ροχ[ᾶς]); Manganaro: παροχ[ᾶς]; the visible traces in the photograph of the bronze are compatible with alpha.
10: Robert, Kaibel: [πρό]ξενον; Manganaro: [πρόξ̣]ενον

English translation

Italian translation

commentary

The primary interest of the text lies in the use, in Greek of the term municipium. This implies a date not earlier than the grant of Latin rights to the Sicilians by Julius Caesar (46 BCE), but more commonly assumed to be of the Augustan period. The attempts by Kajava (followed by Korhonen and Soraci) to date it relative to IG XIV.955 on palaeographic grounds are not sustainable.

bibliography

    14.0954 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072 Franz 3.5491.b (add. p.1248) https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001252 Garrucci 1847 58-59 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002226 Robert 1936 130 no.84, pl.XLIII https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001271 Manganaro 1963 214, tav.LXVII.5 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001847 Kajava 2014 206 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001420
    Korhonen Soraci 2019 102-103 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002542
